intro: Thyrsanthema semifloscularis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thyrsin, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, typical of the genus Thyrsanthema. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight pubescence. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
